These are ~1000x cheaper than the O(n²) FLOATING POINT operations in standard attention:

| Operation | Per-pair cost | 1M pairs |
|-----------|---------------|----------|
| Integer equality (POS match) | ~1 cycle | ~1μs |
| Dot product (768-dim) | ~1536 cycles | ~1
The proposal is to predetermine which pairs are semantically compatible (based on categorical properties like POS, valence slots, semantic class) and skip the rest entirely

The structure is inspired by atomic physics — how bonding rules constrain which atoms can interact — but the actual contribution is computational: fewer FLOPs, interpretable sparsity patterns, and structure that might improve compositional generalization
